trans-unit.source: Using Remote Desktop through xrdp to connect a Microsoft Azure Linux VM.
trans-unit.target: Using Remote Desktop through xrdp to connect a Microsoft Azure Linux VM.

trans-unit.source: Learn how to Install and Config Remote Desktop on a Microsoft Azure Linux VM.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to Install and Config Remote Desktop on a Microsoft Azure Linux VM.

trans-unit.source: RDP(Remote Desktop Protocol) is however a proprietary protocol used for Windows, how can we use RDP to connect Linux VM remotely?
trans-unit.target: RDP(Remote Desktop Protocol) is however a proprietary protocol used for Windows, how can we use RDP to connect Linux VM remotely?

trans-unit.source: This guidance will give you the answer!
trans-unit.target: This guidance will give you the answer!

trans-unit.source: It will help you to install and config xrdp on your Microsoft Azure Linux VM(virtual machine), and you are able to connect it with Remote Desktop from a Windows machine.
trans-unit.target: It will help you to install and config xrdp on your Microsoft Azure Linux VM(virtual machine), and you are able to connect it with Remote Desktop from a Windows machine.

trans-unit.source: Xrdp is an open source RDP server, which allows you to connect your Linux server with Remote Desktop from a Windows machine.
trans-unit.target: Xrdp is an open source RDP server, which allows you to connect your Linux server with Remote Desktop from a Windows machine.

trans-unit.source: It performs much nicer than VNC (Virtual Network Computing).
trans-unit.target: It performs much nicer than VNC (Virtual Network Computing).

trans-unit.source: VNC has this streak of “JPEG” quality and slow behavior, whereas RDP is fast and crystal clear.
trans-unit.target: VNC has this streak of “JPEG” quality and slow behavior, whereas RDP is fast and crystal clear.

trans-unit.source: You must already have an Microsoft Azure VM running Linux.
trans-unit.target: You must already have an Microsoft Azure VM running Linux.

trans-unit.source: To create and set up a Linux VM, see the <linkText>Azure Linux VM tutorial</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To create and set up a Linux VM, see the <linkText>Azure Linux VM tutorial</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: We will use the default endpoint 3389 for Remote Desktop in this doc.
trans-unit.target: We will use the default endpoint 3389 for Remote Desktop in this doc.

trans-unit.source: So set up 3389 endpoint as Remote Desktop to your Linux VM like below:
trans-unit.target: So set up 3389 endpoint as Remote Desktop to your Linux VM like below:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>image</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>image</linkText>

trans-unit.source: if you didn't know how to set up endpoint to your VM, see <linkText>guidance</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: if you didn't know how to set up endpoint to your VM, see <linkText>guidance</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.target: Connect to your Linux VM through putty, and install Gnome Desktop.

trans-unit.source: Because current xrop could not support the Gnome Desktop from Ubuntu version later than Ubuntu 12.04LTS, we will use xfce Desktop instead.
trans-unit.target: Because current xrop could not support the Gnome Desktop from Ubuntu version later than Ubuntu 12.04LTS, we will use xfce Desktop instead.

trans-unit.source: Install xfce, use:
trans-unit.target: Install xfce, use:

trans-unit.source: Then enable xfce, use:
trans-unit.target: Then enable xfce, use:

trans-unit.source: Edit the config file /etc/xrdp/startwm.sh, use:
trans-unit.target: Edit the config file /etc/xrdp/startwm.sh, use:

trans-unit.source: Add line xfce4-session before the line /etc/X11/Xsession.
trans-unit.target: Add line xfce4-session before the line /etc/X11/Xsession.

trans-unit.source: Restart xrdp service, use:
trans-unit.target: Restart xrdp service, use:

trans-unit.source: In a Windows machine, start the remote desktop client, input your Linux VM DNS name or go to Dashboard of your VM in Azure portal and click Connect, you will see below login window:
trans-unit.target: In a Windows machine, start the remote desktop client, input your Linux VM DNS name or go to Dashboard of your VM in Azure portal and click Connect, you will see below login window:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>image</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>image</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Login with the user & password for your Linux VM, and enjoy the Remote Desktop from your Microsoft Azure Linux VM right now!
trans-unit.target: Login with the user & password for your Linux VM, and enjoy the Remote Desktop from your Microsoft Azure Linux VM right now!
